Question: Since the 1970s, China has actively integrated into the world, and the following events occurred in the following order: a. restoration of its legitimate seat in the United Nations; Nixon's visit to China; Ping Pong Diplomacy; Establishing diplomatic relations between China and the United States; China and Japan sign a joint statement on diplomatic relations
The fundamental reason for the success of the Asia Africa Conference is
A: It did not involve colonial countries
B: The promotion of China's policy of seeking common ground while reserving differences
C: Asian and African countries share a common desire to unite against imperialism and colonialism
D: There are no contradictions or differences among Asian and African countries

Question: Which of the following is an inevitable result and objective trend of the development of state relations?

The diplomatic policies and guidelines of our country in the new era include: a Non Aligned Policy; Establish friendly relations with neighboring countries; C is leaning against a large area; D Open to the outside world

At the end of 1948 to the beginning of 1949, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China established an important diplomatic policy, shifting the issue of recognition from a one-way "recognition" of the new regime to a two-way mutual recognition with foreign governments. Mao Zedong summarized this diplomatic policy as
A: Clean up the house before inviting guests
C: Seeking common ground while reserving differences
